top_categories.workout_context: Wollombi Gravel Fest rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Wollombi Gravel Fest’s gravel roads, valley terrain demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Wollombi Gravel Fest isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Wollombi Gravel Fest when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Wollombi Gravel Fest. Make this intensity feel like home.
Wollombi Gravel Fest’s valley gravel roads drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Wollombi Gravel Fest’s valley gravel roads and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The varied gradients at Wollombi Gravel Fest reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Wollombi Gravel Fest — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Wollombi Gravel Fest — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on valley gravel roads.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Wollombi Gravel Fest — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Wollombi Gravel Fest’s 3,500ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Wollombi Gravel Fest’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Wollombi Gravel Fest requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on valley gravel roads to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, valley terrain, rolling hills.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 62 miles of valley gravel roads in Wollombi Valley, New South Wales.
